image.altText: A man in a suit speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Federal Labor will push through legislation today that could derail a legal battle over salmon farming's impact on an endangered ray and safeguard the industry's future in Tasmania.

title.children: Environmental laws set to be scaled back in parliament's final days to save salmon jobs

image.altText: Close-up of grapes on vine, with row of netted grapes vines in background.

props.synopsis: While growers say they are always anxious about the risk of smoke taint from bushfires and burn-offs, conditions in Tasmania are ripening for a bumper wine grape harvest this year.

title.children: Amid weather 'whims', Tassie grape growers expect a bumper harvest

image.altText: Burnt bushfire area.

props.synopsis: As crews continue efforts to put them out

title.children: Fires on Tasmania's west coast 'still smouldering' 50 days on

image.altText: Text message graphic.

props.synopsis: Hobart tenant Katie found out the "sublet agreement" she had signed with a company called Arx Pty Ltd could be invalid — and she had no tenancy rights in Tasmania.

title.children: A sharehouse was run by a 'sublandlord' company. It could be unlawful

image.altText: Aerial view of green oval surrounded by colourful houses on the coast with ocean and beach in the foreground.

props.synopsis: This year the small north-west town of Penguin celebrates its 150th anniversary. What started as a settlement trading timber and potatoes by sea has turned into a bustling tourist town.

title.children: From timber and potatoes to tourism, Penguin celebrates 150 years

image.altText: Nicola is a young woman with blonde hair. She's wearing a sunhat and is smiling. The background is blurred trees and nature.

props.synopsis: Nicola Toki speaks about what she hopes to gain from her Australian visit.

title.children: What can New Zealand learn from Australia's invasive species management?

image.altText: A hung up portrait of a man in formal attire with a gold frame.

props.synopsis: The US president took to Truth Social to call for the removal of his "purposefully distorted" portrait on display in Denver, by an artist who "must have lost her talent as she got older".

title.children: 'Obama looks wonderful, but mine is the worst': Trump demands removal of portrait

image.altText: Calculator sits on pile of bills

props.synopsis: The federal government is promising another power bill rebate. But questions remain about the long-term solutions to Australia's energy price pains.

title.children: Causes of higher power prices remain as government offers $150 rebate

image.altText: A man in a blue polo shirt speaks in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: The WA Liberals look set to become the state's official opposition party once again, after claiming victory in a seventh seat, by less than 100 votes.

title.children: WA Liberals claim Kalamunda victory, paving way for return to opposition

image.altText: Three Palestinian childrensit together

props.synopsis: The number of Gazans killed in the current conflict surpasses the death toll for any Arab conflict with Israel in more than 40 years.

title.children: As the death toll passes 50,000, 'everyone is targeted' in Gaza

image.altText: a woman claps while a man in a blue tie waves to the crowd

props.synopsis: Usha Vance, the wife of US Vice President JD Vance, is set to make a high profile visit to Greenland this week.

title.children: Greenland’s PM slams visit by US officials, including Usha Vance

image.altText: 23andme headquarters in Silicon Valley

props.synopsis: The company, which provides its customers with saliva-based test kits to help them learn their ancestry, is seeking to sell its assets, which include users' DNA data.

title.children: DNA testing firm 23andMe files for bankruptcy after CEO's failed takeover bids

image.altText: A middle-aged caucasian women with shoulder length blonde hair

props.synopsis: The mother of British transgender teen Brianna Ghey speaks out in support of a social media ban for children aged under 16.

title.children: 'Absolute cesspit': Mother of murdered teen Brianna Ghey backs under-16 social media ban

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair sits at her table, looks directly at the camera next to some pieces of paper and her reading glasses.

props.synopsis: A WA woman has been left without teeth, tens of thousands of dollars poorer and desperate for implants after two dentists were charged with criminal offences.

title.children: Dental patient trapped mid-procedure in two-year, $33,000 nightmare

image.altText: People hold placards and protest at the USAID building in Washington

props.synopsis: Sweden, Norway and the Netherlands have contact US officials asking for their unspent contributions to USAID — a program Donald Trump has halted — to be refunded.

title.children: Sweden, Norway and the Netherlands want their money back from USAID

props.synopsis: Police and paramedics were called to a house on Chestnut Place in The Gap just before 4.30pm on Monday.

title.children: Man arrested at airport after 79yo woman found dead in Brisbane

image.altText: The South Sydney Rabbitohs rabbit mascot walking the touchline

props.synopsis: A viral video appearing to show the South Sydney Rabbitohs' mascot pushing a child has prompted the prime minister to defend the man inside the bunny costume.

title.children: 'He's 81 and gentle': PM defends NRL mascot amid storm over viral video

image.altText: Police move search for Joanne Ratcliffe and Kirste Gordan

props.synopsis: A new private search will begin in the state's Mid North for Joanne Ratcliffe and Kirste Gordon, who went missing from Adelaide Oval more than 50 years ago.

title.children: Renewed SA search for children who went missing more than 50 years ago

image.altText: People and pets cool down at the beach during a February heat wave in Perth.

props.synopsis: Perth and many of Western Australia's coastal communities are yet again in the grip of an unseasonal heatwave, with a hot streak that has not been seen in 40 years predicted.

title.children: 'Extreme heat': Unusual March hot spell not seen in 40 years grips Perth

props.synopsis: An inquiry into the deaths of four defence members in a helicopter crash off Queensland's coast has become heated, as an unlikely witness took the stand.

title.children: Ray Hadley gives evidence at Taipan inquiry over broadcast about crash

image.altText: Aboriginal man in hi-vis with a smiling boy on his shoulders

props.synopsis: The family of a boy with autism who went missing from a remote Kimberley community on the weekend have thanked everyone involved in his safe return after a community-wide search.

title.children: Searchers track lost boy's footprints to find him clutching tree in river

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

props.synopsis: Australians love an underdog and in 1983, Cliff Young transfixed the nation when he beat the world's best to shuffle to victory from Sydney to Melbourne. His legend endures.

title.children: How a 61yo potato farmer thrashed Australia's best ultramarathon runners

image.altText: Actor Gerard Depardieu attends a news conference and points his finger at the crowd.

props.synopsis: The French actor is facing trial in Paris after being accused of sexual assault by two women, allegations he has denied.

title.children: Gerard Depardieu trial a test for post-#MeToo France

image.altText: Albanese and Dutton in a compositie image close up.

props.synopsis: While Australian politicians argue about power bill relief and non-existent nuclear power stations, pressing issues like the great US retreat, global warming and AI are being ignored.

title.children: We're at a turning point in world history but our leaders are distracted

image.altText: A young girl lying on a bed with a nasal canula placed

props.synopsis: The parents of South Australian twin girls with conditions that mean they regularly need resuscitating vow to fight an NDIA decision to refuse a request for more support from registered nurses.

title.children: Girls with rare genetic conditions kept from school after funding rejection

image.altText: Sam Kerr

props.synopsis: Matildas coach Tom Sermanni hoped to have his inspirational captain back in the fold for upcoming friendlies against South Korea, but Sam Kerr's English club has vetoed the plan.

title.children: Kerr ruled out of playing with Matildas against South Korea

image.altText: A female footballer in brown and gold stripes kicks downfield just before she is tackled.

props.synopsis: One of Cairns AFL's most successful women's teams is falling apart on the eve of the new season, with a champion accusing the club of refusing to pay even a third of the money allocated to its men's team.

title.children: 'They need to be heard': Premiership hero, coach quit in anger after gender pay row

image.altText: Central Coast Mariners forward Angel Torres

props.synopsis: The sexual assault trial of former Central Coast Mariners player Angel Torres has heard he met his alleged victim at a Terrigal nightclub and used Instagram to show her he was a professional football player.

title.children: Court hears A-League player said 'you'll ruin my career' pursuing alleged victim

image.altText: Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri at the Chinese Grand Prix talking in parc ferme, wearing their racing suits

props.synopsis: McLaren, the 2024 constructors' champions, has made the perfect start to the year with Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri claiming the first two grands prix of 2025.

title.children: Norris 'nervous and excited' as teammate Piastri claims F1 win

image.altText: Monique Ryan's husband is filmed removing rival a candidate's signage

props.synopsis: The husband of federal Victorian MP Monique Ryan has apologised after being filmed removing a sign belonging to rival Kooyong candidate Amelia Hamer.

title.children: 'A mistake': Monique Ryan’s husband apologises after removing Liberal sign

image.altText: A hand holding coal sludge near a creek.

props.synopsis: Coal mine operator Peabody Energy, found guilty of two separate Metropolitan Mine pollution events in 2022, has been ordered to pay more than half a million dollars in penalties and legal fees.

title.children: Coal miner Peabody to pay $500,000 for polluting Royal National Park

image.altText: Mum kissing her baby's hands

props.synopsis: There are several evidence-based advantages associated with late-age births — for both mum and bub — and experts say we should be talking about them more.

title.children: The surprising health benefits linked to having a baby later in life

image.altText: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister James Marape points up with his right index finger.

props.synopsis: Seventy projects outlined in a confidential PNG cabinet document include acquiring a luxury island in partnership with a Congolese rapper, exploring the potential for a world-class Formula 1 track, creating a "Silicon Valley style hub" for entrepreneurs and setting up a spy agency with training from Israel.

title.children: 'Reads more like science fiction': PNG's wish list for the future slammed

image.altText: Photo of murdered Lake Macquarie woman Carly McBride

props.synopsis: Prosecutors allege James Anthony Cunneen spent three years helping another man avoid arrest for the murder of Carly McBride, whose remains were found in bushland near Scone in 2016.

title.children: Murder cover-up accused 'tried to cast blame' on others, court told
